article.title: Charge Localization and Ordering in A$_2$Mn$_8$O$_{16}$ Hollandite Group Oxides: Impact of Density Functional Theory Approaches

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the space group of the tetragonal cell of the ideal hollandite structure (x=2)?
choices: I4/mmm
I4/m
I2/m
P4/mmm

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding the preferred location of the cations (Ag, K, Li) in the tunnels of the hollandite structure?
choices: All cations prefer a symmetrical coordination at the center of the large 2 × 2 tunnel.
Ag and K prefer a symmetrical coordination, while Li prefers off-center positions.
All cations prefer off-center positions within the large 2 × 2 tunnel.
The location of the cation is independent of its ionic radius.

multiple_choice_question.text: Based on the visualization of the MnO6 octahedra in Figure 1, what type of magnetic ordering is depicted?
choices: Ferromagnetic
Ferrimagnetic
Antiferromagnetic
Paramagnetic

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the local coordinates and bond length definitions in Figure 2 help to illustrate?
choices: The concept of electron density within the octahedra.
The definition of the Jahn-Teller distortion parameters Q2 and Q3.
The different possible spin orientations for Mn ions.
The bonding angles between Mn and O atoms.

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical phenomena do the order parameters Q2 and Q3, defined in formulas (1) and (2), quantify?
choices: Electron density distribution around Mn ions.
Local Jahn-Teller distortions in octahedral crystal fields.
Strength of magnetic interactions between Mn ions.
Energy gain associated with charge ordering.
